components: 1. Acknowledge: Show you read/understood the post
2. Add Data: Share your specific experience
3. Provide Insight: Connect to broader pattern
4. Invite Dialog: Ask a question or offer perspective
thoughtful_comment_formula.template: This resonates with our experience at [COMPANY]. We tried [APPROACH] and saw [RESULT]. The key difference was [INSIGHT]. Have you found [QUESTION]?

good_examples.comment: Fascinating approach. At [YOUR_COMPANY], we hit similar walls until we realized users are experts at problems, terrible at solutions. Watching [XXX] sessions taught us more than [X,XXX] surveys. How are you balancing qualitative vs quantitative insights?

This aligns with something counterintuitive we found across [X] marketplaces: limiting choice increased retention [X.X]x. The magic number was [X] options, not [XX]. Have you tested similar thresholds in your space?

The '[FRAMEWORK]' framework worked for us here. We analyzed [XXX] user requests and found [XX]% fell into [X] categories. Focusing on the top [X] doubled our velocity. Curious how you're handling the 'everything is urgent' problem?

engagement_triggers.description: What makes people respond to comments

comment_timing.description: When to comment for maximum visibility

optimal_windows.thought_leaders: Within first hour of post (be in first 10 comments)
optimal_windows.company_posts: Within first day (official posts stay visible longer)

comment_timing.setup: Set up mobile notifications for key people and hashtags

strategic_liking.description: When and what to like strategically
tactics: Like posts from target employees (not mass-like)
Like thought leader posts you engage with
Space out likes (not 20 in a row)
avoid: Liking without commenting on important posts

bad_templates: I'd like to add you to my professional network.
I saw we both work in [INDUSTRY].

connection_sequence.description: Order of connection requests to build credibility
sequence: 1. Junior team members (higher acceptance, lower risk)
3. Senior ICs (after engaging with their content)
connection_sequence.rate_limit: 2-3 connections per day to avoid spam flags

post_connection_engagement.description: What to do after connection is accepted
timeline: Day 3-5: Like/comment on one of their posts
Day 14+: Ask thoughtful question or offer value
avoid: Immediate sales pitch or job ask

timeline: Touch 2 (Day 3): Engage with 2-3 of their posts (organic)
principles: Always provide value, never just 'checking in'
If no response after 6, move on gracefully

positive_response.description: What to do when they engage back
positive_response.first_response: Thanks for connecting/responding! [ACKNOWLEDGE_THEIR_POINT]. Would love to hear more about [THEIR_CHALLENGE]. Do you have 15 minutes for a quick call this week?
positive_response.scheduling: Offer 3 specific times, use Calendly/link if possible

no_response.description: What to do when they don't respond
no_response.value_add: Each follow-up must provide new value
no_response.graceful_exit: After 6 touches, send: 'I know you're busyâ€”last thing from me: [FINAL_VALUE]. Best of luck with [PROJECT].'

negative_response.description: What to do if they decline or push back
negative_response.gracious_response: Totally understandâ€”appreciate you letting me know. Best of luck with [PROJECT]!
negative_response.learn: Reflect on what might have been off

thought_leader_hijack.setup: Set up mobile notifications for key thought leaders
thought_leader_hijack.benefit: Their followers (including your targets) see you as expert

alumni_network_play.description: Connect with people who left target company
alumni_network_play.approach: Hey [NAME], saw you were at [COMPANY]. I'm exploring opportunities there and would love [X] minutes to hear about your experience.
alumni_network_play.respect: They left for a reasonâ€”don't push if hesitant

indirect_mention.tactic: Post about their industry/challenges without tagging them
indirect_mention.example: Fascinating how [INDUSTRY] companies face [SPECIFIC_CHALLENGE]. The [X,XXX] [DATA_POINTS] we analyzed showed...
indirect_mention.benefit: Their employees will likely see organically, feels less forced

sequence: 2. Reach out to mutual: 'Hey, I noticed you know [TARGET]. I'm exploring opportunities at [COMPANY]â€”any context you can share?'
3. Don't ask for intro yet (just context)
4. When connecting with target: 'Hi [NAME], [MUTUAL] mentioned you're doing interesting work on [PROJECT]...'
5. Only ask for intro if mutual offers

content_seeding.description: Plant content that surfaces in their searches
tactics: Write about their company's challenges (without tagging)
Engage with content their team engages with
Comment on industry news they care about
Share frameworks relevant to their problems
content_seeding.goal: Be discoverable when they search for solutions

ethical_boundaries.description: What NOT to do (respect and authenticity)
never_do: Pretend you've used their product (if you haven't)
Comment just to get noticed (not add value)
Reach out to multiple people same day at same company
Like 20 posts in a row from same person
always_do: Only engage where you have real insight
